name: vancouver summer
description:
10 years ago today, I showed up to a pub 3 hours early to get a spot to watch the Vancouver Canucks play game 7 of the Stanley Cup Finals against the Boston Bruins. As you know, it didn't go particularly well. If I remember correctly, it was one of those games where it felt like the Nuckies never really had a chance. 
We headed home on the bus, and got off at close to home. My partner and I looked down the corridor to downtown and wondered what was going on. Smoke billowed up from the streets into the hazy summer sky. 
We were disappointed about the Canucks losing like everyone else, but couldn’t do the mental gymnastics to figure out that people were rioting. Our jaws dropped when we turned on the news.
‘Vancouver Summer’ centres that fateful June evening as the beginning of a summer to remember. It’s amazing how that big moment serves as signposts for the little ones. From losing your keys to going for a swim. From late-night dance parties to the exact shirt you were wearing on a particular day. And holding hands through the whole thing.
